subQuestion.ans: 3 metres = 300 cm.We can cut it into 50 cm pieces.Since 300 is exactly divisible 50.That is 300 is multiples of 50.300 ÷ 50 = 6We will get 6 pieces, nothing is left over.

questions.questionsTitle: A ribbon is 3 metres long. I need 8 pieces of ribbon each 40 cm long. How many centimetres shorter is the ribbon than the length I need?

subQuestion.question: A ribbon is 3 metres long. I need 8 pieces of ribbon each 40 cm long. How many centimetres shorter is the ribbon than the length I need?
subQuestion.ans: 1 piece of 40 cm, so for 8 pieces ribbon needed is 40 × 8 = 320 cm.But ribbon is 3 metre = 300 cm long.So ribbon is shorter by 320 – 300 = 20 cm.

questions.questionsTitle: If we take 4 rounds around a field that is 160 m long and 90 m wide, what is the distance we walk in kilometers?

subQuestion.question: If we take 4 rounds around a field that is 160 m long and 90 m wide, what is the distance we walk in kilometers?
subQuestion.ans: Perimeter of a rectangular field= 2 × length + 2 × breadth= 2 × 160 + 2 × 90= 320 + 180= 500 mIn one round, distance walked is 500 m; hence, distance walked in 4 rounds.= 500 × 4 = 2000 m= 2 km∴ The distance walked in 4 rounds is 2 km.

questions.questionsTitle: Sanju completes 12 rounds around a square park every day. If one side of the park is 120 m, find out in kilometres and metres the distance that Sanju covers daily.

subQuestion.question: Sanju completes 12 rounds around a square park every day. If one side of the park is 120 m, find out in kilometres and metres the distance that Sanju covers daily.
subQuestion.ans: The perimeter of a square= 4 x length of one side= 4 x 120= 480 mSo, in one round the distance can be covered is 480 m; hence, in 12 rounds the distance can be covered is,= 480 x 12 = 5760 m= 5000 m + 760 m∴ Sanju covers 5 kilometres and 760 metres daily.

questions.questionsTitle: The length of a rectangular plot of land is 50 m and its width is 30 m. A triple fence has to be put along its edges. If the wire costs 60 rupees per metre, what will be the total cost of the wire needed for the fence?

subQuestion.question: The length of a rectangular plot of land is 50 m and its width is 30 m. A triple fence has to be put along its edges. If the wire costs 60 rupees per metre, what will be the total cost of the wire needed for the fence?
subQuestion.ans: Perimeter of a rectangular plot= 2 x length + 2 x breadth= 2 x 50 + 2 x 30= 100 + 60= 160 mFor a triple fence, wire needed= 3 x 160= 480 mCost of the wire needed= wire needed x rate= 480 x 60= 28800 rupees∴ The total cost of the wire needed for the fence is ₹ 28,800.

subQuestion.ans: The perimeter of a square= 4 × length of one side= 4 × 20= 80 mIn one round 80 m.So in 5 round = 80 × 5 = 400= 400 m∴ He runs altogether = 400 m.

subQuestion.ans: Subtracting zero from any number gives the number itself.

questions.questionsTitle: Write the following property in words:

subQuestion.question: n ÷ 1 = n
subQuestion.ans: Dividing any number by 1 gives the number itself.
